definition: to flow back/reflux/circumfluence/refluence/backward flow/returning flow (e.g. of talent)
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: The proposed repeat of the corporate tax repatriation holiday is one such wolf in sheep's clothing.
sentences.chinese: 重提回流資金減稅就是這種批着羊皮的狼。

sentences.english: Upon completion of the Three Gorges project, the sewage will back up in the reservoir.
sentences.chinese: 大壩建成後，這些污水將回流至水庫中。

sentences.english: The water flowed back and covered the chariots and horsemen-the entire army of Pharaoh that had followed the Israelites into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 水就回流，淹沒了車輛和馬兵。

sentences.english: The system should be flushed before the backflow valve is installed.
sentences.chinese: 在安裝回流閥之前系統應該進行沖刷。

definition: to flow/to circulate/to go from place to place/to be mobile/(of assets) liquid
hot money, money flowing from one currency to another in the hope of quick profit
expansion/dilation/to expand (e.g. one's power or influence)/to broaden
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
against the stream/adverse current/a countercurrent/fig. reactionary tendency/to go against the trend
(of soil etc) to wash away/to be eroded/(fig.) (of talented staff, followers of a religious faith, investment funds etc) to go elsewhere/to fail to be retained
